content.description: Sit start on the rock protruding from the ground with your hands on the blocky, incut holds. Move left to gain the black crack. Adjust hands and feet to move right up the arete to finish.
content.location: It is on the west face of Back Door Boulder # 1, BR46.

content.description: Sit start with your hands on a almost vertical, left-facing ledge and high feet. The first move is getting one of your hands on the horizontal ledge on top of the starting hold. Move up and left to the lip, and have a few more nice moves with a good view of the highway. You may wish this problem was hundreds of feet off the deck!
content.location: It is on Back Door Boulder # 1's (BR46) southwest face. Find the almost vertical, left-facing hand hold.

content.description: Squat start the north arete as far left as you can. Move right on the razor arete. Gain the jug at the top of the arete, and mantel your way to the send! The stand start goes a little easier.
content.location: This is on the North side of Back Door Boulder # 1, B46.

content.description: Located on Backdoor Boulder #1.Sit start the north arete as far left as possible. Move right along the arete to the jug peak, and mantel up. A rock over onto your left heel for the top out will save a lot of extra effort.
Start on a left crimp and right sloper on the lip with thin feet, traverse the lip right, and top out. This requires some really cool and subtle foot beta.
content.location: It is on the left side of the south face.

content.description: Low sit start matched on the crimp rail on the steep left side of the boulder that faces route 1. Make a big move out left to the crimp on the arête. Move up and traverse the arête all the way right to the highpoint of the boulder and top out.. Classic!
content.location: Find the crimp rail on the northwest face of the Back Door Boulder 1 - Bow Ridge 46.

content.description: Start with your hands matched on the good crimp rail on the right side of the face with a decent left foot hold. Traverse left (crux) across the face into the start of Code of Silence. Top out up and left onto the slab above. This is a very crimpy problem.
content.location: It is on Back Door Boulder #2 on the side that faces the trail.

content.description: Sit start with decent feet and decent handholds, and move up and slightly left on really marginal dishes, crimps, and bad feet to a freakish topout.
content.location: This is located on Backdoor Boulder #2 on the side that faces the trail.

content.description: The back entrance of Lynn Woods could be considered the Deep Woods Trail trailhead off the power line trail. If you head towards the Deep Woods Trail via Bow Ridge Reservation, you'll pass these two boulders which sit on the left (south) side of the power line clearing as seen from the Bow Ridge trail crossing.
